title: Trap Line Status
text:
Trap Status




The target is to have traps checked every 2 weeks. The table below uses colour coding of;




14 Days: green




28 Days: yellow




28+ Days: red





Expand any trap line to see who most recently checked, and when.














This chart shows the cumulative number of traps checked within the last (x) days

title: Trap Line Summary and Status
text: A Summary of catches by year, and also the last 2 and 4 weeks with comparison to the 2 and 4 week windows for the same time of year from the prior year.

title: Kaitake Ranges Conservation Trust
text:
Contents




About: The Why’s, Where’s, Who’s and What’s




Status: Statistics of catch history for the traps managed




Trap Line Summary: An interactive table for interrogating Lines and Traps




Trap Line Status: An interactive table showing servicing history by trap line

title: Trap Line Summary
text:
This table gives some summary information for each trap within the trapping project. You can use the search box below each column header to filter on a specific item (e.g. a specific trap line, trap, date or last species caught). There is also a generic search box which will search any column.  Clicking on any of the column headers will allow you to sort. Keep clicking to toggle between ascending or descending. If you want to sort by more than one column, hold the shift button down when clicking any subsequent columns. Keep holding the shift button down if you want to reverse the sort order.  Examples on how you might use this table include;


Search for your trap line


Sort by last species caught (or use the search filter again) to find which traps catch the most or least of any species


Sort by last catch date to see which traps have caught recently and what species that was


Sort by days since last catch to see which traps haven’t had a recent catch


 You can expand the number of rows with the ‘Show’ drop down selection at the bottom of the table.
